item.title: Microsoft Build 2019 - Thoughts
item.description: Last week I attended my fifth Build (in a row! ðŸ¤¯). The conference and the company behind it has undergone almost a lot of change since 2015 when I first went, and I wanted to jot down my thoughts on the stuff I learned and the direction I think Microsoft is heading. What’s Hot My number one take away this year is that Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning has really matured to a point where I should take it more seriously.

item.title: Hello, World (Or Yet Another .NET Dev Blog)
item.description: ðŸ‘‹ Hi, I’m Ryan. I’m a software engineer with 10+ years experience in muddling through developing applications and websites. Most of those years I’ve spent doing C# & .NET, which I’m pretty passionate about (still!). I’m most interested in Application Development (Desktop and Mobile) and DevOps, but in the last decade I’ve had the pleasure (or pain, depending…) of working with: .NET / C# / VB.NET HoloLens (Oooh. ðŸŒŸ) Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) Universal Windows Platform (UWP) WinForms (Ahh!
